items.title: PLC Fundamentals (Level I)
items.headline: This course will give a person with no prior experience the basic tools necessary to create a PLC program from scratch.
objectives_summary: By the end of this course, you will be able to create a PLC program from scratch.
The primary and overall objective of this course is to give a novice an understanding of PLC programming, ladder logic, and the inner workings of a standard HMI (Human-Machine Interface).
Students will learn the difference between digital and analog signals and how to bring them into a PLC, process them, and send them back out.

items.title: Mastering Microcontroller and Embedded Driver Development

visible_instructors.title: FastBit Embedded Brain Academy
visible_instructors.name: FastBit Embedded
visible_instructors.job_title: Works on Firmware and Embedded Engineering

items.headline: (MCU1) Learn bare metal driver development using Embedded C: Writing drivers for STM32 GPIO,I2C,SPI,USART  from scratch
objectives_summary: Understand Right ways of Handling and programming MCU Peripherals
Develop Peripheral drivers for your Microcontroller
Understand complete Driver Development steps right from scratch for GPIO,SPI,I2C and USART.

items.title: Arduino Step by Step: Getting Started

visible_instructors.title: Dr. Peter Dalmaris
visible_instructors.name: Dr. Peter
visible_instructors.job_title: Educator and Author of "Maker Education Revolution".

items.headline: The original comprehensive course designed for new Arduino Makers
objectives_summary: Build simple circuits around the Arduino Uno, that implement simple functions.
Write simple Arduino sketches that can get sensor reading, make LEDs blink, write text on an LCD screen, read the position of a potentiometer, and much more.
Understand what is the Arduino.

items.headline: Foundation course on Embedded C programming  using STM32 Microcontroller.
objectives_summary: 'C' programming from scratch
Data types,variables, declarations,
Importance of Bit-Wise operators in "Embedded" programming

items.title: Learn 5 PLCs in a Day-AB, Siemens, Schneider, Omron & Delta
items.headline: PLC Programming of Allen Bradley, Delta, Siemens, Omron & Schneider using LIVE Examples with HMI Interfacing
objectives_summary: To Learn Ladder Logic Programming
PLC Wiring Concepts & Troubleshooting
To Teach Programming to Technician & Engineer

items.title: Arduino Programming and Hardware Fundamentals with Hackster
items.headline: Learn electrical engineering basics to build circuits and program Arduino to make wearables, robots, and IoT devices
objectives_summary: Master the fundamentals of Arduino programming with C/C++
Build functioning circuits on a breadboard
Control sensors, robots, and Internet of Things (IoT) devices using Arduino

items.headline: Learn Running/Porting FreeRTOS Real Time Operating System on  STM32F4x and ARM cortex M based Mircocontrollers
objectives_summary: Understanding various RTOS concepts with FreeRTOS Programming and Debugging
Learn Complete Step by step method to run FreeRTOS on STM32 MCUs using OpenSTM32 System Workbench
Using STM32 Standard Peripheral Driver APIs to configure peripherals

items.title: From Wire to PLC , A Bootcamp In Industrial Automation
items.headline: Build Electrical Automation Projects From Sctratch. Starting From  Wires , Control Circuits And Ending With PLC And HMI
objectives_summary: Design Factories Automation from A to Z
Design Automation  Electrical Panels
Draw Schematics for Electrical  panels

items.title: Embedded Systems Programming on ARM Cortex-M3/M4 Processor

visible_instructors.title: FastBit Embedded Brain Academy

items.headline: With hands on coding using C Programming and assembly on ARM Cortex M Processor based Microcontroller
objectives_summary: Internal architecture of  ARM Cortex M3/M4 processor and programming
Learn Mixed ‘C’ and Assembly Coding using inline assembly technique
Demystifying Memory, Bus interfaces, NVIC, Exception handling with lots of animation

items.title: Applied Logic (Level 2)
items.headline: This course will give an intermediate-level student the experience necessary to originate complex, logical solutions.
objectives_summary: By the end of this course, you will be both able and practiced at originating complex ladder logic applications.
The primary and overall objective of this course is to give an INTERMEDIATE PLC programming student, rigorous, practical experience in creating unguided, original ladder logic.

Students will build on the knowledge and understanding of PLC programming they got from "PLC Programming from Scratch" by using those instructions and environments and techniques to create real-world solutions to problems defined throughout this course.

items.title: Learn Siemens S7-1200 PLC & HMI from Scratch using TIA
items.headline: Learn wiring, programming and Installation of  S7-1200 PLC & HMI with Siemens TIA- Total Integrated Automation Software
objectives_summary: Learn how to communicate PLC with PC using Siemens TIA
Learn how to convert standard circuits to PLC Circuits
Learn fundamentals commands of Siemens S7-1200 in TIA

items.title: Learn to Design Your Own Boards
items.headline: Design a board in 15 hours. Step-by-Step tutorial based on Arduino project (Altium)
objectives_summary: After this course, you will design your own Arduino like board.

items.title: TIA Portal Master Project (Level 5)
items.headline: Learn (hands-on) to create complete PLC and HMI solutions from absolute zero in TIA Portal.
objectives_summary: By the end of this course, you will be able to program Siemens PLCs using ALL of the IEC programming languages supported in TIA Portal.
You will know how to create complete HMI projects using WinCC RT Professional.

At your next interview, you'll be able to bring your laptop with a fully functional PLC program and HMI both running live to actually demonstrate everything you've learned in this course (which will be quite a lot).

Kernel, Bootloaders compilations Step-by-Step and testing on Beaglebone Hardware
U-Boot, MLO, SPL, explanation and Testing

items.headline: Device to AWS Cloud integration:  Programming Embedded Devices and managing data in AWS IoT
objectives_summary: Program the ESP8266, ESP32, or Raspberry Pi 3 to send data to AWS IoT Core
Connect to AWS free Tier and use relevant AWS services
Understand MQTT, JSON, IoT, and the AWS cloud

items.title: Mastering Microcontroller: Timers, PWM, CAN, Low Power(MCU2)

visible_instructors.title: FastBit Embedded Brain Academy

visible_instructors.job_title: Works on Firmware and Embedded Engineering

items.headline: Learn STM32 Timers, CAN, RTC, PWM, Low Power embedded systems and program them using STM32 Device HAL APIs step by step.
objectives_summary: You will learn from scratch about STM32 Timers : Basic and General Purpose Timers
Understand General purpose timer's Input capture and Output compare unit handling and Exercises
Handling of Timer interrupts : Time base interrupts, capture interrupts, compare interrupts
